item.title: Atmospheric action adventure game CALX adds PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch versions; PC demo now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Explore the first zone of the planet Syro.

Atmospheric action adventure game CALX, formerly XTAL, will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch alongside its previously announced PC (Steam) version, publisher Dear Villagers and developer True Colors announced. A demo is available now for PC via Steam.

The demo lets players experience the opening of the game, featuring a full tutorial that introduces all core mechanics, along with a section of the Canyon, the game’s first zone. It takes about one hour to complete.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

CALX is an atmospheric 3D action adventure inspired by visionary science-fiction art. Explore planet Syro—vast landscapes filled with crystal structures and ancient technology. Find out what the WARP did to the Quoths civilization. The environment guides you, revealing secrets through exploration.

The game moves between stillness and frenzy. Silent moments give way to frantic fights in a rhythm like waves—contemplation, then action, then back again. Art and music work in tandem. The mesmerizing visuals shape the soundscape, and the music breathes life back into the art.

You are alone on Syro, but not lonely. A speck of dust in a vast, mysterious world. There’s a quiet melancholy to wandering these forgotten places.

Movement Opens the World

Movement is your main tool. Double jump, air dash, levitate, and use a grappling hook to reach new areas. The world is interconnected. It opens as you gain new abilities. Rediscover hidden paths through revisiting old areas.

The world tells its story as you explore. Secrets are concealed in ruins. Puzzles emerge as you investigate. The environment reveals the past events.

Contemplative, With Meaningful Combat

Your companion AFX travels with you and grows stronger as you progress. Combat mixes melee attacks and ranged shots. Perfect your ‘dodge’ timing to gain tactical advantages in fights.

You’ll collect upgrades throughout your journey. These enhance your combat and movement skills. Find new weapons in the ruins. Each one changes how you approach fights.

Fights test how well you move, not just how fast you attack. Combat areas work like movement puzzles. Your mobility matters as much as your weapons.

Different Zones, Different Moods

Each area has its own feel. Some are quiet and still, while others pulse with strange energy. The game values calm moments as much as action.

You upgrade by finding pieces of old technology. These upgrades change how you move through the world. Choose freely which areas to explore next

CALX is about 10 to 15 hours long. Reminiscent of classic action adventure games.

Key Features

  • Atmospheric Exploration on Planet Syro – Vast landscapes filled with crystal structures and ancient tech shaped by visionary science-fiction art.
  • Movement as Your Main Tool – Double jump, aerial dash, levitate, and grappling hook mechanics that open new paths as you progress.
  • Contemplative Pacing – A game that values stillness and observation as much as action.
  • Interconnected World Design – Gain new abilities to unlock hidden areas and discover secrets in places you’ve already visited.
  • Combat Meets Mobility – Blend melee strikes with AFX’s ranged shots. Perfect dodges for tactical advantages.
  • Environmental Storytelling – The ruins and landscape reveal what happened, with minimal dialogue and maximum atmosphere.
  • Meaningful Upgrades – Collect remnants of ancient technology to enhance both combat and movement abilities.
  • Art and Music in Tandem – Mesmerizing visuals shape the soundscape; music breathes life back into the art.

item.title: BMX Streets now available for PS5
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Freestyle extreme biking simulation game comes to console.

Mash Games has released a PlayStation 5 version of freestyle extreme biking simulation game BMX Streets via PlayStation Store for $33.49 / £24.49 / €28.99, the developer announced.

BMX Streets first launched for PC via Steam on April 5, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via Mash Games:

About

BMX Streets is a next generation physics driven freestyle extreme biking simulator. BMX Streets captures the essence of BMX culture by giving players the ability to find their own style of riding through practice, experimentation, and exploration.

Key Features

  • Revolutionary Controls – Bumpers are your hands, triggers are your feet. BMX Streets puts you in complete control of your bike, whether its on the ground, in the air, or grinding down a handrail. The perfect balance of accessibility and depth, the control system allows you fully express yourself, from learning the basics to pushing the limits.
  • Physics Like No Other – BMX Streets physics make riding anything fun. Get technical on ledges and rails, send huge roof drops or thread your way around backyard bowls; it’s all about your style.
  • Endless Customization – Build your bike to match your style with over 1,000 bike parts. Build your dream bike that not only looks good, but lets your ride the way you want to.
  • Hit the Streets – BMX Streets‘ maps are built by riders for riders. Find your best line, session a new spot, and share your best tricks with replay editor.

item.title: Lyrical Games to publish new title from The Chinese Room
item.content:encoded:
The studio behind Still Wakes the Deep and more.

Lyrical Games has announced a publishing partnership with The Chinese Room, the British development student behind Still Wakes the Deep, Everybody’s Gone to the Rapture, and Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2, the companies announced.

Lyrical Games is providing “full financing, strategic production support, and collaborative go-to-market planning” for the project, while The Chinese Room maintains its creative autonomy and intellectual property ownership.

“From our earliest conversations with The Chinese Room, it was immediately clear we had to back this strong vision for the world that they wanted to build,” said Lyrical Games head Blake Rochkind in a press release. “Now more than ever, our role as a publisher is to remove friction from their journey. We’re committed to providing them with clarity and resources so that they can focus on making this title truly exceptional.”

The Chinese Room CEO Ed Daly added, “Our partnership with Lyrical Games gives us the confidence and support to push creatively in the ways that are needed to stand out in today’s market. Now, we can focus on elevating the player experience while Lyrical ensures that the game reaches those players.”

Further information about the new game was not announced.
